definitions.definition: Someone who tips; someone who gives a gratuity.
definitions.example: The Americans are among the most generous tippers in the world.

definitions.definition: A small moustache.
A goods vehicle with a tippable body, used for carrying loose materials such as gravel or rubble; a tipper truck or lorry.
A device for loading goods such as coal by tipping them.
One who gives private hints about racing or financial speculation, etc.; a tipster.
(also in plural form) A cutting tool used to cut off or trim the horns of stock animals; a horn tipper.
A kind of ale brewed with brackish water obtained from a particular well.
A felt hat in the shape of a truncated cone, having a flat top with a tassel attached.
The act of obstructing, or state of being obstructed.
Something which obstructs or impedes, either intentionally or unintentionally
The condition of having the natural powers obstructed in their usual course; the arrest of the vital functions; death.
Any water containing dissolved salt; brine
New Keynesian or Keynesian, in reference to macroeconomics and economics departments on the East Coast and West Coast of the United States of America.
Shy; not liking to be noticed; socially timid.
Indicating bashfulness.
definitions.example: a bashful look

definitions.definition: Darkness, dimness or obscurity.
definitions.example: the gloom of a forest, or of midnight

definitions.definition: A melancholic, depressing or despondent atmosphere.
Cloudiness or heaviness of mind; melancholy; aspect of sorrow; low spirits; dullness.
A drying oven used in gunpowder manufacture.
To be dark or gloomy.
To look or feel sad, sullen or despondent.
To render gloomy or dark; to obscure; to darken.
To fill with gloom; to make sad, dismal, or sullen.
To shine or appear obscurely or imperfectly; to glimmer.
A form of acting without words; pantomime.
A pantomime actor.
A classical theatrical entertainment in the form of farce.
A performer of such a farce.
A person who mimics others in a comical manner.
Any of various papilionid butterflies of the genus Chilasa or Papilio, that mimic other species in appearance.
To mimic.
To act without words.
To represent an action or object through gesture, without the use of sound.
An earthenware container, either with two or no handles, for holding oil, water, wine, etc., or used for burial.
A small, approximately cylindrical container, normally made of clay or glass, for holding fruit, preserves, etc., or for ornamental purposes.
A jar and its contents; as much as fills such a container; a jarful.
To preserve (food) in a jar.
A clashing or discordant set of sounds, particularly with a quivering or vibrating quality.
A quivering or vibrating movement or sensation resulting from something being shaken or struck.
(by extension) A sense of alarm or dismay.
The effect of something contradictory or discordant; a clash.
A disagreement, a dispute, a quarrel; contention, discord; quarrelling.
To knock, shake, or strike sharply, especially causing a quivering or vibrating movement.
definitions.example: He hit it with a hammer, hoping he could jar it loose.

definitions.definition: To harm or injure by such action.
To shock or surprise.
definitions.example: I think the accident jarred him, as he hasn’t got back in a car since.

definitions.definition: To act in disagreement or opposition, to clash, to be at odds with; to interfere; to dispute, to quarrel.
To (cause something to) give forth a rudely tremulous or quivering sound; to (cause something to) sound discordantly or harshly.
definitions.example: The clashing notes jarred on my ears.

definitions.definition: To quiver or vibrate due to being shaken or struck.
Of the appearance, form, style, etc., of people and things: to look strangely different; to stand out awkwardly from its surroundings; to be incongruent.
Normie
A wooden bar, or iron pin.
Material used to create an engineered product.
To provide a place with furniture, or other equipment.
To supply or give (something).
To supply (somebody) with something.
Any of very many parasitic or free-living worms, of the phylum Platyhelminthes, having a flattened body with no skeleton or body cavity.
That part of the balance of payments recording a nation's exports and imports of goods and services and transfer payments
A checking account (US) at a bank which is used for daily transactions, as opposed to a deposit account or savings account.
Filled with smoke.
definitions.example: a smoky cabin

definitions.definition: Giving off smoke.
definitions.example: a smoky oil lamp

definitions.definition: Of a colour or colour pattern similar to that of smoke.
Having a flavour or odour like smoke; flavoured with smoke.
definitions.example: a smoky whisky

definitions.definition: Resembling or composed of smoke.
Blackened by smoke.
(of a person's voice) Having a deep, raspy quality, often as a result of smoking tobacco.
Attractive in a sensual way; sultry.
Having a dark, thick, bass sound.
definitions.example: a few smoky jazz notes

definitions.definition: Giving off steam or vapour.
Obscuring or insubstantial like smoke.
Suspicious; open to suspicion; jealous.
A relatively small (sand- to boulder-sized) fragment of debris in a star system that produces a meteor when it hits the atmosphere
To live temporarily in someone else's home for the purpose of protecting and tending to it in the owner's or tenant's absence.
definitions.example: I'm house-sitting for my friends while they're on vacation in France.

definitions.definition: A particular type of electronic dance music with an uptempo beat and recurring kickdrum.
(with "the") Something uncertain.
Not certain; unsure.
Not known for certain; questionable.
definitions.example: Tomorrow's weather is uncertain.

definitions.definition: Not yet determined; undecided.
Variable and subject to change.
Fitful or unsteady.
Unpredictable or capricious.
To put forth blooms.
definitions.example: This plant flowers in June.

definitions.definition: To decorate with pictures of flowers.
To reach a state of full development or achievement.
To froth; to ferment gently, as new beer.
To come off as flowers by sublimation.
The action of the verb to flower.
The period of time during which a plant is in flower.
The period of time during which someone or something is at its peak.
(used only before the noun) Of a plant, that produces flowers.
definitions.example: Azaleas are flowering plants.

definitions.definition: Aflower, in bloom
A cloud in outer space consisting of gas or dust (e.g. a cloud formed after a star explodes).
A white spot or slight opacity of the cornea.
A cloudy appearance in the urine
In the context of a two-party system, especially in the United States, cooperation between the competing political parties; governing in a bipartisan manner.
Therapy that uses physical techniques such as massage, ultrasound, heat, and exercise
A foreign businessman in China; a tycoon.
Any venomous elapid snake of the genus Oxyuranus, found in Australia and New Guinea.
A synthetic opioid analgesic, used to wean addicts off heroin or other opiate based narcotics, and in chronic pain management.
A kind of unleavened flatbread commonly consumed in South Asia and the Caribbean.
definitions.example: Nepalis eat sweet fried rice-flour doughnuts called sel roti.

definitions.definition: To ski down a mountain or glacier that has been reached by helicopter rather than a normal ski lift.
Skiing in remote areas after being transported by helicopter
A long, narrow strip of timber bent and bolted longitudinally to the ribs of a vessel, to hold them in position and give rigidity to the framework.
A ribbon.
A long, narrow strip of material used for decoration of clothing or the hair or gift wrapping.
An awareness ribbon.
An inked strip of material against which type is pressed to print letters in a typewriter or printer.
A narrow strip or shred.
definitions.example: a steel or magnesium ribbon

definitions.definition: A painted moulding on the side of a ship.
A watchspring.
A bandsaw.
(in the plural) Reins for a horse.
A bearing similar to the bend, but only one eighth as wide.
(spinning) A sliver.
A subheadline presented above its parent headline.
A toolbar that incorporates tabs and menus.
To decorate with ribbon.
To stripe or streak.
A fermented, typically non-alcoholic, drink flavoured with ginger.
A glass or drink of ginger beer.
definitions.example: I'm having a ginger beer - would you like one too?

definitions.definition: (usually used in the shortened form ginger) queer (i.e. homosexual).
(usually used in the shortened form ginger) queer (i.e. homosexual).
An inhabitant/citizen of Caesarea.
Of or relating to Caesarea.
Of, relating to or in the manner of Julius Caesar or other Caesars.
A Caesarean section.
Somewhat resembling the Roman; applied sometimes to the debased style of the later Roman Empire, but especially to the more developed art and architecture prevailing from the 8th century to the 12th.
The finger between the forefinger and the ring finger
An obscene gesture directed towards another as an insult, made by sticking up the middle finger of a hand.
An insult directed at someone.
Any abrupt and inexplicable transition or occurrence.
definitions.example: Having a costumed superhero abduct the vicar was an utter non sequitur in the novel.

definitions.definition: Any invalid argument in which the conclusion cannot be logically deduced from the premises; a logical fallacy.
A statement that does not logically follow a statement that came before it.
(humor) A kind of pun that uses a change of word, subject, or meaning to make a joke of the listener’s expectation.
The writing of history; a written history.
The study of the discipline and practice of history and the writings of past historians.
A clergy member.
An idle animation.
An idle game.
To spend in idleness; to waste; to consume.
To lose or spend time doing nothing, or without being employed in business.
Of an engine: to run at a slow speed, or out of gear; to tick over.
Empty, vacant.
Not being used appropriately; not occupied; (of time) with no, no important, or not much activity.
definitions.example: My computer hibernates after it has been idle for 30 minutes.

definitions.definition: Not engaged in any occupation or employment; unemployed; inactive; doing nothing in particular.
definitions.example: idle workmen

definitions.definition: Averse to work, labor or employment; lazy; slothful.
definitions.example: an idle fellow

definitions.definition: Of no importance; useless; worthless; vain; trifling; thoughtless; silly.
definitions.example: an idle story;  idle talk;  idle rumor

definitions.definition: Light-headed; foolish.
A force compounded by means of a lever rotating around a pivot; see torque.
definitions.example: A crowbar uses leverage to pry nails out of wood.

definitions.definition: By extension, any influence which is compounded or used to gain an advantage.
definitions.example: Try using competitors’ prices for leverage in the negotiation.

definitions.definition: The use of borrowed funds with a contractually determined return to increase the ability of a business to invest and earn an expected higher return, but usually at high risk.
definitions.example: Leverage is great until something goes wrong with your investments and you still have to pay your debts.

definitions.definition: The ability to earn very high returns when operating at high capacity utilization of a facility.
definitions.example: Their variable-cost-reducing investments have dramatically increased their leverage.

definitions.definition: To use; to exploit; to manipulate in order to take full advantage (of something).
definitions.example: They plan to leverage off the publicity to get a good distribution agreement.

definitions.definition: To boil food briefly so that it is partly cooked.
A person who lacks courage.
To intimidate.
Cowardly.
(of a lion) Borne in the escutcheon with his tail doubled between his legs.
A specific topic raised in a conversation or argument which is intended as a basis for further discussion, especially one which represents a point of view.
A rectangular piece of thick paper or thin cardboard intended to be written on and mailed without an envelope. In the case of a picture postcard one side carries a picture or photograph.
To send a postcard to.
definitions.example: to postcard one's friends

definitions.definition: To send by means of a postcard.
definitions.example: to postcard one's news

definitions.definition: A (usually women's) team sport derived from basketball, with seven players on each side who attempt to score goals by passing a ball and throwing it into the opponent's goal, which is a raised hoop with a net at one end of the playing area. Unlike basketball, a player in possession of the ball cannot move until the ball is passed to another player.
The ball used in this sport.
Any salt of sulfurous acid.
A person who is spontaneous and original in thought and conversation.
Of, relating to, or occurring in the stratosphere.
Unusually or unreasonably high; astronomical.
definitions.example: The hotel charged stratospheric prices for a simple cooked breakfast.

definitions.definition: (grammar) The possessive case.
(grammar) A word used to indicate the possessive case.
Of or pertaining to ownership or possession.
(grammar) Indicating ownership, possession, origin, etc.
Unwilling to yield possession of.
definitions.example: He is very possessive of his car.

definitions.definition: Accommodating attitude or opinion, as in receptivity to new ideas, behaviors, cultures, peoples, environments, experiences, etc., different from the familiar, conventional, traditional, or one's own.
The degree to which a person, group, organization, institution, or society exhibits this liberal attitude or opinion.
Lack of secrecy; candour, transparency.

Degree of accessibility to view, use, and modify in a shared environment with legal rights generally held in common and preventing proprietary restrictions on the right of others to continue viewing, using, modifying and sharing.
(systems theory) The degree to which a system operates with distinct boundaries across which exchange occurs capable of inducing change in the system while maintaining the boundaries themselves.
A skirt worn underneath another skirt; a petticoat.
An under layer of a multi-layer gown over which outer skirts are draped.
Punctuation mark “!” (used to denote excitement, surprise or shock).
definitions.example: The excessive use of exclamation marks devalues their effect, but is typical of concise genres such as cartoons, not reference works!

definitions.definition: A unit of a military organization whose duty is to police the organization. They are in charge of law enforcement on military property, and of military personnel.
A mixture of methane and carbon dioxide, produced by anaerobic digestion of organic waste matter, used as a fuel
To take part in kitesurfing.
A type of kiteboarding that happens in the water, where the rider is on a surfboard and is propelled by a power kite.
A two-wheeled horse-drawn vehicle, used in Bronze Age and Early Iron Age warfare.
A light four-wheeled carriage used for ceremonial or pleasure purposes.
(xiangqi) rook
To convey by, or as if by, chariot.
To ride in a chariot.
A hybrid sport in which participants travel along a canyon using a variety of techniques that may include walking, climbing, jumping, abseiling, or swimming.
A type of padding sometimes used in clothing to give the wearer the illusion of less sloping shoulders.
A piece of protective equipment used in American and Canadian football.
A person or company that acts in the sale, lease or maintenance of land, property, real estate etc for another.
A land bailiff.
A confused disordered jumble of things.
Background echoes, from clouds etc., on a radar or sonar screen.
A group of cats; the collective noun for cats.
Clatter; confused noise.
To fill something with clutter.
To clot or coagulate, like blood.
To make a confused noise; to bustle.
To utter words hurriedly, especially (but not exclusively) as a speech disorder (compare cluttering).
To walk very fast for exercise.
Initialism of as far as I know.
An advocacy group.
A partner who is not actively involved in the running of a business
To take off (said of an aircraft, especially a rocket, to leave the ground)
A grandchild.
definitions.example: They love spending time with all six of their grandkids, and they carry the photos to prove it.

definitions.definition: A bump left on the skin after having been stung.
A bite by an insect.
A pointed portion of an insect or arachnid used for attack.
A sharp, localised pain primarily on the epidermis
A sharp-pointed hollow hair seated on a gland which secretes an acrid fluid, as in nettles.
The thrust of a sting into the flesh; the act of stinging; a wound inflicted by stinging.
(law enforcement) A police operation in which the police pretend to be criminals in order to catch a criminal.
A short percussive phrase played by a drummer to accent the punchline in a comedy show.
A brief sequence of music used in films, TV, and video games as a form of scenic punctuation or to identify the broadcasting station.
A support for a wind tunnel model which extends parallel to the air flow.
The harmful or painful part of something.
A goad; incitement.
The concluding point of an epigram or other sarcastic saying.
To hurt, usually by introducing poison or a sharp point, or both.
definitions.example: Right so came out an adder of a little heathbush, and it stung a knight in the foot.

definitions.definition: (of an insect) To bite.
(sometimes figurative) To hurt, to be in pain.
definitions.example: My hand stings after knocking on the door so long.

definitions.definition: To cause harm or pain to.
definitions.example: I thought I could park in front of the hotel, but they stung me for five pounds!

definitions.definition: A new growth on a plant, whether from seed or other parts.
A child.
(chiefly in the plural) A Brussels sprout.
(chiefly in the plural) A bean sprout.
An edible germinated seed.
To grow from seed; to germinate.
To cause to grow from a seed.
definitions.example: I sprouted beans and radishes and put them in my salad.

definitions.definition: To deprive of sprouts.
definitions.example: to sprout potatoes

definitions.definition: To emerge from the ground as sprouts.
To emerge haphazardly from a surface.
definitions.example: Whiskers sprouted from the old man's chin.

definitions.definition: A plush toy in the shape of a bear.
A lovable, endearing, large, strong, hairy, or sweet man
A person who begs.
A person suffering from extreme poverty.
(sometimes affectionate) A mean or wretched person; a scoundrel.
definitions.example: What does that silly beggar think he's doing?

definitions.definition: A minced oath for bugger.
To make a beggar of someone; impoverish.
To exhaust the resources of; to outdo.
A chemical used to make fabric water-repellent.
That slows the penetration of water (but is not waterproof).
To outrun or leave behind.
definitions.example: We quickly outstripped the amateur runners.

definitions.definition: To exceed, excel or surpass.
definitions.example: This year's production has already outstripped last year's.

definitions.definition: That can be inherited.
definitions.example: an inheritable disease

definitions.definition: Capable of taking by inheritance, or of receiving by descent; capable of succeeding to, as an heir.
Recent news, especially in-depth analysis of issues and events.
A slothful or stupid person.
Usually preceded by the: a state of apathy or lack of interest; a situation where one feels boredom, ennui, or tedium; a state of listlessness or malaise.
definitions.example: I was in the doldrums yesterday and just didn’t feel inspired.

definitions.definition: Usually preceded by the: the state of a sailing ship when it is impeded by calms or light, baffling winds, and is unable to make progress.
(by extension) Usually preceded by the: a part of the ocean near the equator where calms, squalls, and light, baffling winds are common.
Having a vigorous, independent will and views.
(of women) Mannish, lacking softness and femininity
Being aware (of something); attentive, heedful.
Inclined (to do something).
As much as can be held in one's mind at a time.
To do or perform an activity which is very risky, or dangerous, and could even cause one's death.
definitions.example: By now, I think everyone is aware that to drink and drive is to dice with death.

definitions.definition: A short, simple advertisement in a newspaper or magazine, usually collected in a section.
An Indonesian food made from partially-cooked fermented soybeans, mixed with a fungus (Rhizopus oligosporus).
An Italian savoury dish made with rice and other ingredients.
definitions.example: Do you like risotto?

definitions.definition: Any channel, either natural or artificial, through which water flows.
Not qualified, ineligible, unfit for a position or task.
definitions.example: His lack of a high school diploma renders him unqualified for the job.

definitions.definition: Not elaborated upon, or not accompanied by restrictions or qualification; undescribed.
definitions.example: Her cooking ability, while mentioned, was unqualified by her.

definitions.definition: Outright; thorough; utter.
A finely-ground paste of meat, fish or vegetables, sometimes with the addition of alcohol.
The state, or kinship of being sisters
The quality of being sisterly; sisterly companionship; especially, the sense that women have of being in solidarity with one another.
A religious society of women
The idea of universal experience amongst women, regardless of other traits or factors. (Considered obsolete in third-wave feminism.)
To stop working on a permanent basis, usually because of old age or illness.
definitions.example: Having made a large fortune, he retired.

definitions.definition: (sometimes reflexive) To withdraw; to take away.
To cease use or production of something.
definitions.example: The steamship made thousands of trips over several decades before it was retired by the shipping company.

definitions.definition: To withdraw from circulation, or from the market; to take up and pay.
definitions.example: The central bank retired those notes five years ago.

definitions.definition: To cause to retire; specifically, to designate as no longer qualified for active service; to place on the retired list.
definitions.example: The board retired the old major.

definitions.definition: (of a batsman) To voluntarily stop batting before being dismissed so that the next batsman can bat.
definitions.example: Jones retired in favour of Smith.

definitions.definition: (of a fielder) To make a play which results in a runner or the batter being out, either by means of a put out, fly out or strikeout.
definitions.example: Jones retired Smith 6-3.

definitions.definition: To go back or return; to withdraw or retreat, especially from public view; to go into privacy.
definitions.example: I will retire to the study.

definitions.definition: To retreat from action or danger; to withdraw for safety or pleasure.
definitions.example: The regiment retired from the fray after the Major was killed.

definitions.definition: To recede; to fall or bend back.
definitions.example: Past the point, the shore retires into a sequence of coves.

definitions.definition: To go to bed.
definitions.example: I will retire for the night.

definitions.definition: To remove or cease to use.
definitions.example: When a hurricane becomes so deadly or destructive that future use would be insensitive, officials may retire the name of the hurricane.

definitions.definition: To fit (a vehicle) with new tires.
Retirement
Introverted, liking privacy and seclusion.
definitions.example: I don't really know him well, since he's so shy and retiring.

definitions.definition: Anything that points or is used for pointing.
A teacher's pointer, pointing stick, a rod with an arrow.
A needle-like component of a timepiece or measuring device that indicates the time or the current reading of the device.
A breed of hunting dog, trained to point out game.
A variable that holds the address of a memory location where a value can be stored.
An icon that indicates the position of the pointing device, such as a mouse.
(chiefly in the plural) A tip, a bit of advice.
definitions.example: The instructor gave me some pointers on writing a good paper.

definitions.definition: (in combinations) Something worth a given number of points.
definitions.example: a ten-pointer

definitions.definition: A capitalistic model of price determination in a market.
Each of the patches of vili on the foetal chorion in the placenta of ruminants and some other mammals.
The leaf of the embryo of a seed-bearing plant; after germination it becomes the first leaves of the seedling.
A fund deposited by a customer (the depositor) in a bank from which they can make withdrawals.
A learning disability characterized by reading and writing difficulties.
To draw or let out wholly; to drain off completely
definitions.example: Moisture of the earth is exhausted by evaporation.

definitions.definition: To empty by drawing or letting out the contents
definitions.example: to exhaust a treasury

definitions.definition: To drain; to use up or expend wholly, or until the supply comes to an end
definitions.example: I exhausted my strength walking up the hill.

definitions.definition: To tire out; to wear out; to cause to be without any energy
definitions.example: The marathon exhausted me.

definitions.definition: To bring out or develop completely
To discuss thoroughly or completely
definitions.example: That subject has already been fully exhausted.

definitions.definition: To subject to the action of various solvents in order to remove all soluble substances or extractives
definitions.example: to exhaust a drug successively with water, alcohol, and ether

definitions.definition: Very tired; in a state of exhaustion.
definitions.example: The exhausted man fell asleep immediately.

definitions.definition: Depleted of resources.
definitions.example: The exhausted mine was worthless once all the ore had been extracted.

definitions.definition: A mineral substance made up of small crystals of silica and alumina, that is ductile when moist; the material of pre-fired ceramics.
An earth material with ductile qualities.
A tennis court surface made of crushed stone, brick, shale, or other unbound mineral aggregate.
definitions.example: The French Open is played on clay.

definitions.definition: The material of the human body.
A particle less than 3.9 microns in diameter, following the Wentworth scale.
A clay pipe for smoking tobacco.
A clay pigeon.
definitions.example: We went shooting clays at the weekend.

definitions.definition: Land or territory of a country or other political region, especially when subject to territorial claims
definitions.example: Danzig is rightfully German clay.

definitions.definition: To add clay to, to spread clay onto.
(of sugar) To purify using clay.
definitions.example: 1809, Jonathan Williams, On the Process of Claying Sugar, in Transactions of the American Philosophical Society, Volume 6.
